title: Chelsea transfer news: Blues have bid rejected for Celtic stopper Craig Gordon as Antonio Conte eyes back-up for Thibaut Courtois
text:
EFL He's a keeper Chelsea transfer news: Blues have bid rejected for Celtic stopper Craig Gordon as Antonio Conte eyes back-up for Thibaut Courtois 
Asmir Begovic's switch to Bournemouth relies heavily on Antonio Conte finding a suitable replacement for Thibaut Courtois Exclusive Comments CELTIC turned down a bid from Chelsea for keeper Craig Gordon this morning. 
Gordon, out of contract at the end of the season, is wanted at Stamford Bridge as back-up to Thibaut Courtois. News Group Newspapers Ltd 3 Chelsea had a bid rejected by Celtic for Craig Gordon on Thursday morning 
Celtic, who last night matched the Lisbon Lions’ record of 26 games domestic games unbeaten, do not want to sell. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Gordon, 34, had a spell in England with Sunderland under Roy Keane, but is in the form of his career under Brendan Rodgers. 
The Celtic chief insists they will not sell before the window closes. 
He said: “His contract is up at the end of the season but there is an option for the club. 
“But it is not something we would consider really. He is someone I want to lock down for during my time here.
